author: Jordan OMalley
title: Outrageous Celebrity Homes That'll Make You Hate Your Apartment Even More!
text:
Louis Tomlinson – Hollywood Hills, £5.3 Million
Louis Tomlinson, famed as a member of the pop sensation One Direction, splurged on a stunning mansion in the Hollywood Hills for £5.3 million in 2016. This lavish abode is designed in a Mediterranean style and features an expansive terrace that offers breathtaking views across Los Angeles.
Louis acquired this home to be closer to his son. It includes luxurious amenities such as a home cinema, a wine cellar, a chef’s kitchen, a master suite with a walk-in wardrobe, a plush bathroom, and a private balcony. The outdoor area is equally impressive, boasting an infinity pool and spa, perfect for soaking up the California sun.
Harry Styles – Los Angeles, £6 Million
Harry Styles, the British pop sensation renowned for his chart-topping hits and charismatic performances, once owned a stunning Los Angeles residence that epitomized Hollywood luxury. In 2016, he acquired a modern abode in the Hollywood Hills. This 4,401-square-foot home, perched above the Sunset Strip, boasts four bedrooms and six bathrooms.
Its open-plan design featured floor-to-ceiling glass walls, flooding the space with natural light and offering breathtaking views of the city and ocean. Amenities included a gourmet kitchen, a home theater, a gym, and multiple terraces. The outdoor area showcased a kidney-shaped pool, hot tub, and a cabana with a sitting area and bar, perfect for entertaining.
Paul McCartney – New York, £11 Million
In 2015, Paul McCartney, the legendary former Beatle, and his wife, Nancy Shevell, acquired a stunning duplex penthouse at 1045 Fifth Avenue in New York City worth £11 million. This opulent residence is perched atop a 15-story building and boasts floor-to-ceiling windows offering panoramic views of Central Park. The 10-room apartment featured a marble staircase, gold bathroom trimmings, and a crystal chandelier, exuding mid-century glamour.
Despite its rich history and elegance, the couple sold the property in 2022, reflecting a significant market shift. This residence remains a testament to Paul’s timeless elegance and connection to New York’s vibrant culture.
Tom Baker – Shropshire, £1.7 Million
Tom Baker, renowned for his portrayal of the fourth Doctor in the iconic British series “Doctor Who,” owns a historic house in Shropshire. Known as Lower House, located in the village of Hopton Castle, this residence dates back to the 15th and 16th centuries. Acquired by Tom and his wife Eileen, the house overlooks a medieval tower house that they were instrumental in preserving.
The property features half-timbered construction and is connected to English Civil War history, having been the site of a notable siege. Tom spearheaded the efforts to preserve the nearby tower house, which was recognized with a Heritage Lottery grant exceeding £1 million.
Joe Swash and Stacey Solomon – Essex, £1.2 Million
Joe Swash and Stacey Solomon, beloved UK television personalities, are the proud owners of a stunning £1.2 million home in Essex, known affectionately as Pickle Cottage. They acquired this picturesque Tudor-style property in 2021 and have since transformed it into a family haven.
The couple has meticulously upgraded the home to include a life-sized Wendy’s house, a man cave, and a luxurious outdoor swimming pool that underwent a significant restoration project. One of the more whimsical touches is a dinosaur-themed bathroom designed especially for their son Rex. The property boasts not just these family-oriented features but also stylish interiors that Stacey often shares on her social media.
Eamonn Holmes – Surrey, £3.25 Million
Eamonn Holmes, a celebrated broadcaster known for his work on shows like “This Morning” and “Sunrise,” shares a luxurious £3.25 million mansion in Surrey with his wife, Ruth Langsford. This stunning home includes six bedrooms, five bathrooms, and multiple reception rooms, providing ample space for their family life and social gatherings.​
The modern amenities are complemented by a beautifully manicured garden and a personal cinema room, enhancing the lavish feel of the residence. A Manchester-United-themed man cave adds a personal touch that reflects Eamonn’s interests. Both Eamonn and Ruth have expressed their deep attachment to the place, which makes it a perfect sanctuary away from the bustling media world.​
Ed Sheeran – Suffolk, £3.7 Million
In 2012, the acclaimed singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran began crafting his personal haven in Suffolk, England, by acquiring a modern farmhouse for £895K. Over the years, he expanded this retreat into the enchanting “Sheeranville,” investing approximately £3.7 million to create a 16-acre estate.
This sprawling sanctuary boasts various features, including a wildlife pond, a treehouse, an underground music room, and even a private pub named The Lancaster Lock. Ed’s dedication to enhancing his estate reflects his deep appreciation for nature and desire for a serene family environment. In 2024, he further demonstrated his commitment to the local community by acquiring a minority stake in Ipswich Town Football Club.
Gordon Ramsay – Cornwall, £4.4 Million
Gordon Ramsay, a celebrated chef and television personality, owns a spectacular house in Cornwall that epitomizes the blend of modern luxury and natural charm. Acquired in 2015, this mansion in Rock, Cornwall, is a masterpiece of design, integrating advanced architectural elements with the serene landscape of the coast.
The home features a significant outdoor area, including a boathouse and an infinity pool, which were part of a comprehensive renovation that dramatically increased its value and appeal. It also comes with a state-of-the-art kitchen—a must for a chef of his caliber—and environmentally sustainable features like a renewable energy source and a collection of custom art.
Piers Morgan – Beverly Hills, £5 Million
Piers Morgan, the often polarizing yet undeniably compelling British broadcaster and journalist, owns a stunning £5 million mansion in Beverly Hills. Purchased in 2011, this lavish residence showcases the height of luxury in one of the world’s most exclusive neighborhoods.
The mansion is equipped with a gourmet kitchen that would thrill any chef, an outdoor swimming pool surrounded by lush gardens, and a spacious patio area perfect for entertaining. Piers has often referred to it as a “dream home” that combines the tranquility of a private retreat with the accessibility of city amenities, providing a perfect backdrop for both his family life and high-profile career engagements.
Jamie Dornan – Los Angeles, £2.4 Million
In 2016, “Fifty Shades of Grey” star Jamie Dornan acquired a stunning mid-century modern gem in Los Angeles for £2.4 million. This architectural masterpiece, initially crafted in 1959 by Edward H. Fickett and later enhanced by Val Powelson, spans 2,510 square feet and boasts four bedrooms and four bathrooms.
The residence features a central glass-walled atrium that seamlessly blends indoor and outdoor spaces. Floor-to-ceiling glass doors open to a serene backyard oasis, complete with a gleaming pool, Japanese hot tub, and fire pit. In 2018, Jamie listed this Hollywood Hills haven, reflecting its timeless allure and his penchant for sophisticated living.
Idris Elba – London, £2.8 Million
In 2016, Idris Elba, the charismatic star of “Luther” and “The Wire,” acquired a Grade II listed residence in Hackney, East London. This Victorian-era gem, dating back to the late 19th century, boasts a red brick façade and a distinctive blue front door, exuding timeless elegance.
The interior seamlessly blends historical charm with modern sophistication. It features a well-lit family room adorned with long, white curtains and contemporary furnishings. The kitchen showcases exposed wooden beams, adding a rustic touch to the sleek design. In 2016, Idris proposed plans to transform the basement into a state-of-the-art film and music studio, reflecting his multifaceted talents.
Jude Law – Maida Vale, £8 Million
In 2008, acclaimed actor Jude Law, known for his roles in “The Talented Mr. Ripley” and “Sherlock Holmes,” purchased a stunning Georgian townhouse in London’s Maida Vale. The four-story residence dates back to the 19th century. The property seamlessly blends historic charm with modern luxury, and internally, it features four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and a single-car garage, fitting for a star of his kind.
The raised ground floor boasts a family room and a farmhouse-style dining room, reflecting Jude’s appreciation for art and the color red. After extensive renovations, Law listed the property in 2013, highlighting its timeless elegance and refined taste.
Emma Watson – New York, £2.8 Million
Emma Watson grew up before our eyes as Hermione Granger in the “Harry Potter” series. When not acting, she reportedly spends her time in this luxurious apartment in New York’s Upper East Side for approximately £2.8 million. This elegant residence is situated in a prestigious building, offering a blend of classic architecture and modern amenities.
The apartment features spacious living areas, high ceilings, and large windows. The building itself boasts a range of facilities, including a fitness center, private storage, and a landscaped rooftop terrace. The location offers proximity to Central Park and some of the city’s finest dining and shopping establishments, aligning with Emma’s sophisticated lifestyle.
Zayn Malik – Bel Air, £3.5 Million
Former One Direction heartthrob Zayn Malik rests in a sleek mid-century modern retreat in Bel Air, Los Angeles. The 2,332-square-foot sanctuary is nestled on nearly an acre of lush hillside and boasts polished concrete floors and expansive sliding glass doors that seamlessly blend indoor and outdoor living.
The residence featured a unique “space” room adorned with an illuminated galaxy ceiling, reflecting Zayn’s eclectic style. The master suite, a fusion of two original bedrooms, offered a spacious haven, while the gourmet kitchen showcased sleek white cabinetry and stainless-steel appliances. With its minimalist design, it is a glimpse of Zayn’s distinctive taste and his journey from boy band sensation to solo artist.
Mia Malkova – Oregon, £3.9 Million
In December 2020, adult film star Mia Malkova and content producer Eli Tucker acquired the enchanting Blackberry Castle in Portland, Oregon, for around £3.9 million. This 13,000-square-foot French-style residence, completed in 2015, boasts five bedrooms, 5.5 bathrooms, and features such as turrets, suits of armor, and family crests.
The castle’s interior includes a two-story library with Oregon’s largest ceiling clock dial, a gym with a climbing wall, and an indoor theater. Mia expressed her admiration for the property’s fantasy theme, stating, “The fact that it’s a castle—that is my favorite part—that it is themed after a castle and has a fantasy theme. It is very eccentric.”
Barbara Bach – Colorado, £3.5 Million
Barbara Bach, celebrated for her role as Bond girl Anya Amasova in “The Spy Who Loved Me,” chose a tranquil retreat in the Colorado mountains as her sanctuary. Nestled in Aspen’s serene landscape, the home boasts expansive windows framing breathtaking mountain vistas, which blend seamlessly with the home’s rustic yet elegant decor, which features natural stone fireplaces.
It is meticulously outfitted with high-end amenities, including a state-of-the-art gourmet kitchen, perfect for entertaining guests, and a spa area. Barbara often expresses her fondness for the house, noting its peaceful environment that significantly contrasts with the bustling Hollywood scene she was once a part of.
George Mackay – London, £4.5 Million
George Mackay, known for his compelling performances in films like “1917” and “Captain Fantastic,” has set down roots in a modern London residence that mirrors his quiet intensity and understated elegance. Acquired in 2020, the home is valued at approximately £4.5 million.
Its architecture seamlessly blends traditional British design with contemporary elements. Expansive glass walls ensure the home is awash with natural light, enhancing the layout. A standout feature is the rooftop terrace, which offers sweeping panoramic views of the London skyline, perfect for entertaining or solitary reflection. Additionally, the private cinema room provides a cozy retreat for movie nights.
Adele – Los Angeles, £7.6 Million
When not belting out her soul-stirring vocals and deeply personal albums, Adele rests in a magnificent £7.6 million mansion in Los Angeles. This luxurious property epitomizes Hollywood glamour and sophistication with its modern, open-plan layout with expansive glass walls.
The estate includes state-of-the-art amenities such as a gourmet kitchen, a private cinema room, and an expansive rooftop terrace that offers stunning panoramic views of the city. Adele often shares how the home serves as a peaceful sanctuary where she finds inspiration for her music. The outdoor space is equally impressive, featuring a sleek swimming pool surrounded by lush gardens, perfect for relaxation and entertaining guests.
Kate Beckinsale – Los Angeles, £4.3 Million
In 2006, “Underworld” star Kate Beckinsale acquired a stunning Cape Cod-style residence in Los Angeles’ Brentwood neighborhood. This 3,600-square-foot abode, built in 1965, boasts four bedrooms and five bathrooms. The interior seamlessly blends classic charm with modern elegance, featuring maple floors, French doors, and exposed beams. The gourmet kitchen, adorned with Carrera marble countertops and dual islands, opens to a cozy family room, creating an inviting space for entertaining.
The primary suite offers a double-sided fireplace, a spa-like bath with a skylight, and a private bridge leading to an outdoor spa tub and shower, providing a serene retreat with views of Mandeville Canyon.
Raj Kundra – Mumbai, £5 Million
Raj Kundra, a prominent British-Indian businessman, and his wife, actress Shilpa Shetty, reside in a lavish seaside bungalow named ‘Kinara’ in Mumbai’s upscale Juhu neighborhood. The mansion boasts interiors personally curated by Shilpa, featuring artifacts and decor sourced globally.
‘Kinara’ offers an array of luxurious amenities, including a state-of-the-art gym, a private bar adorned with cricket memorabilia, and a serene garden overlooking the Arabian Sea. The residence also houses a dedicated temple area, reflecting the couple’s spiritual inclinations. Shilpa has expressed her fondness for the ambiance and breathtaking sea views, stating that waking up to the sound of waves is one of her favorite aspects of living there.
David Furnish – Beverly Hills, £4.5 Million
Film producer David Furnish and his husband, music legend Elton John, added to their portfolio this mid-century modern masterpiece in Beverly Hills. This 5,000-square-foot residence, originally built in 1966, boasts four bedrooms and five bathrooms. The couple enlisted designer Martyn Lawrence Bullard to craft interiors that harmoniously blend contemporary art with family-friendly spaces.
The home features an open-plan living and dining area, a state-of-the-art kitchen, and floor-to-ceiling windows. The outdoor area includes a swimming pool, a terrace, and meticulously landscaped gardens. In 2021, they expanded their estate by purchasing the neighboring property for £6.2 million, creating a combined compound that reflects their appreciation for art, design, and luxurious living.
Emma Thompson – London, £4.5 Million
Nestled in the serene enclave of West Hampstead, London, Dame Emma Thompson’s residence exudes timeless elegance and personal history. The acclaimed actress and screenwriter celebrated for her roles in “Sense and Sensibility” and “Love Actually” resides on the very street where she spent her formative years.
This connection deepens as her mother, actress Phyllida Law, lives just across the road, fostering a close-knit family atmosphere. The home’s architecture reflects the area’s distinctive charm, characterized by colorful mansion blocks and red-brick buildings. Its proximity to lush green spaces offers a tranquil retreat from the city’s hustle. In 2023, Emma and her husband, Greg Wise, actively opposed a proposed development in the neighborhood.
Ringo Starr – England, £2 Million
Imagine stepping into a 17th-century English mansion, where history intertwines with rock ‘n’ roll legend. This was the reality for Ringo Starr when he acquired the Rydinghurst Estate in Cranleigh, Surrey, in 1999 for £2 million. The Grade II listed property, set amidst 200 acres of lush gardens and serene ponds, became a sanctuary for the former Beatles drummer.
Ringo transformed the estate into a personal haven, with a music room housing his gold records and drum kits and another expansive space for live performances. The estate’s allure lies in its architectural beauty and connection to music history, having been the creative retreat for one of rock’s most iconic figures.
Daniel Craig – Spilsby, £12 Million
In 2013, whispers swirled that Daniel Craig, the iconic James Bond actor, was eyeing the opulent Dalby Hall Estate near Spilsby, Lincolnshire. This magnificent 19th-century Grade II listed mansion, set amidst 1,051 acres of lush parkland, was on the market for £12 million. The estate boasted an eight-bedroom hall, a private airstrip, a trout lake, and seven charming cottages.
Despite this, there is no confirmed evidence that Daniel acquired the property. Instead, he and his wife, Rachel Weisz, have been known to reside in a £6 million Victorian terrace in London’s Primrose Hill, a residence they have lovingly renovated.
Kelly Osbourne – Los Feliz, £3.5 Million
Kelly Osbourne owns a mid-century modern masterpiece in Los Angeles’ Los Feliz Oaks neighborhood. This 1963 architectural gem, spanning 2,450 square feet, boasts an open floor plan with floor-to-ceiling windows that flood the space with natural light.
The residence features terrazzo flooring, a sleek fireplace, and a wraparound terrace offering panoramic views of the city and surrounding hills. The kitchen, adorned with mint-colored cabinetry, seamlessly blends vintage charm with modern amenities. The primary suite includes a spa-like bathroom leading to an outdoor soaking tub, providing a serene retreat. This Los Feliz residence stands as a testament to Kelly’s sophisticated taste and appreciation for timeless design.
Sunny Leone – Los Angeles, £4.3 Million
Bollywood sensation Sunny Leone and her husband, Daniel Weber, boast a stunning country-style mansion in Los Angeles’ Sherman Oaks neighborhood. This expansive estate, spanning over an acre, boasts five luxurious bedrooms, a state-of-the-art home theater, and a swimming pool. The couple meticulously curated the interiors, sourcing exquisite artifacts from Italy, Rome, and Spain, as well as a two-foot bronze statue of Lord Ganesha at the entrance, symbolizing prosperity and protection.
The mansion’s expansive deck offers panoramic views of Los Angeles, making it an ideal spot for intimate gatherings and serene evenings. In 2021, they decided to list the property for sale, aiming to relocate closer to their work commitments in India.
Andrew Garfield – Beverly Hills, £2 Million
Andrew Garfield, renowned for his role in “The Amazing Spider-Man,” acquired a charming Beverly Hills residence for £2 million. The 3,862-square-foot, ranch-style home, previously owned by the late actor Dudley Moore, boasts four bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms.
The interior features a step-down living room with vaulted wood ceilings, clerestory windows, and a full wall of French doors. The vintage-style kitchen is equipped with modern appliances, and the master suite includes French doors leading to the pool area. The backyard features a pool and raised decking. Situated in a private, gated community, the residence provides a serene retreat amidst the bustling city.
Michael Caine – London, £7 Million
Sir Michael Caine, a distinguished British film icon, resides in a penthouse overlooking Chelsea Harbour in London. Acclaimed for his roles in more than 130 films over six decades, including classics like “The Italian Job” and “Alfie,” his London abode is as elegant as his career. The penthouse, part of a modern complex, offers panoramic views of the Thames and the bustling city.
Inside, the living space is adorned with high-end finishes, a state-of-the-art kitchen, and expansive living areas that open onto private balconies. The property also includes access to exclusive amenities such as a gym, pool, and underground parking. Michael, who values privacy and tranquility, appreciates the penthouse’s secure environment.
John Cleese – Montecito, £12 Million
John Cleese, the legendary British comedian and actor known for his work with the Monty Python comedy troupe and the classic TV series “Fawlty Towers,” once owned a grand estate in Montecito, California. Also known as Stalloreggi, it boasted a Mediterranean-style main house with three bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms, a horse barn, dressage rings, and multiple two-bedroom apartments, one of which served as a writing studio.
The estate also featured exquisite landscapes with links to riding trails in Romero Canyon and access to the Pacific Ocean. John had always expressed his love for Montecito due to its tranquil environment and rich cultural offerings, from great restaurants to music and art.
Dhani Harrison – Los Angeles, £3.99 Million
Dhani Harrison, celebrated musician and son of the legendary George Harrison of The Beatles, owns a strikingly modern home in the Venice Canals of Los Angeles. At $3.99 million, this residence is as enchanting as it is private, nestled within one of the city’s most picturesque neighborhoods.
The three-story, 2,826-square-foot property features two bedrooms and three bathrooms and showcases a blend of chic and contemporary design elements. The house is designed to maximize the stunning canal views with floor-to-ceiling windows, and it boasts multiple outdoor spaces, including a rooftop deck offering panoramic views. This makes it a serene retreat from the vibrant city life just steps away.
Kelly Macdonald – Glasgow, £1.2 Million
Kelly Macdonald, renowned for her compelling roles in films like “Trainspotting” and “No Country for Old Men,” has nestled herself in a stunning modern residence in Glasgow. This house, acquired in 2019 for £1.2 million, is a testament to her Scottish roots and her refined taste.
The home features expansive glass walls that allow for abundant natural light, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The interior boasts a state-of-the-art kitchen, perfect for her love of cooking. Kelly often shares her appreciation for the home’s design and functionality, emphasizing how it’s also her way of maintaining a connection with her Glasgow heritage.
Steve McManaman – Manchester, £2.5 Million
Former footballer Steve McManaman is celebrated for his dynamic midfield play. Outside the field, he finds solace in the magnificent £2.5 million mansion in Manchester. Acquired in the zenith of his career in 1999, this luxurious property radiates elegance and modern sophistication.
The house boasts a state-of-the-art kitchen, a private cinema room for cozy movie nights, and an indoor swimming pool that rivals the finest spas, making it a perfect retreat for relaxation and entertainment. Steve has often expressed his love for the home and his family, noting that its tranquil environment provides a perfect balance to his high-octane career highlights.
Joan Collins – California, £3.8 Million
Joan Collins, the legendary actress who was celebrated for her role as Alexis Carrington in the 1980s television series “Dynasty,” has been a prominent figure in Hollywood for decades. In 2017, she listed her opulent West Hollywood condominium in the renowned Sierra Towers.
Situated on the 25th floor, it offers panoramic views of the Hollywood Hills and the Pacific Ocean. The condo features two bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, marble floors, and granite countertops. The building itself boasts amenities such as a heated pool, spa, fitness center, valet parking, and 24-hour security. Joan’s personal touch is evident throughout the home, with mirrored and lacquered surfaces adding to its glamorous ambiance.
Tom Hardy – Richmond, £3.2 Million
Imagine strolling through the streets of Richmond, London, and stumbling upon a residence that exudes both historical and modern luxury. This is the home of acclaimed actor Tom Hardy, renowned for his transformative roles in films like “Inception” and “Mad Max: Fury Road.” In 2015, he acquired this two-story Georgian masterpiece, which the value has appreciated to £3.4 million.
The house boasts a harmonious blend of classic architecture and contemporary amenities. While specific interior details remain private, the property’s allure lies in its timeless elegance and prime location. Nestled among the residences of notable figures like Sir Mick Jagger and Sir David Attenborough, Tom’s home is a testament to refined taste.
Rishi Sunak – Kensington, £7 Million
In 2010, Rishi Sunak, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, and his wife, Akshata Murty, acquired a luxurious five-bedroom mews house in Kensington, London. This elegant residence spans four stories and features four bathrooms, two reception rooms, and a private garden, offering a harmonious blend of classic architecture and modern amenities.
The property’s prime location in one of London’s most prestigious neighborhoods adds to its value, providing both privacy and proximity to the city’s cultural and commercial hubs. Over the years, the house has appreciated in value, reflecting the desirability of the area and the property’s exceptional features.
Daniel Radcliffe – Melbourne, £3.6 Million
In 2004, Daniel Radcliffe, renowned for his portrayal of Harry Potter, acquired a luxurious penthouse in Melbourne’s prestigious Toorak suburb. Occupying the entire upper level of its complex, the space features three bedrooms, two bathrooms, and an expansive open-plan living area.
Floor-to-ceiling windows offer breathtaking views of the Yarra River, while the modern kitchen boasts a butler’s pantry, catering to both intimate gatherings and grand entertaining. Accessible via a private lift, the penthouse ensures exclusivity and privacy. The spacious terrace provides a serene outdoor retreat, perfect for enjoying Melbourne’s temperate climate. In 2021, Daniel sold this exquisite property, reflecting its enduring appeal and connection to Australia.
J.K. Rowling – Edinburgh, £2 Million
In 2009, J.K. Rowling, the celebrated author of the “Harry Potter” series, acquired a stunning 17th-century mansion in Edinburgh’s affluent Barnton area for £2 million. This historic property, known as The Whitehouse, boasts eight bedrooms, seven bathrooms, and expansive gardens, offering a blend of timeless elegance and modern luxury.
The mansion’s rich history and architectural grandeur make it a fitting residence for the literary icon. In 2022, J.K. undertook significant renovations, including trimming the property’s massive hedge, which necessitated the temporary closure of Whitehouse Road to ensure the work was completed safely. This attention to detail reflects her commitment to preserving the estate’s beauty and heritage.
Cheryl Cole – Hertfordshire, £5 Million
Singer and television personality Cheryl acquired a stunning six-bedroom mansion in Radlett, Hertfordshire, for £5 million. This eco-friendly residence, known as Brickfields, was designed by Living in Space, a London-based design and architecture firm. The property features a unique combination of red tessellated brick and large glass panes, paying homage to the site’s history as a former brickmaker’s yard.
It boasts an indoor swimming pool, steam room, gym, and a private cinema. The master suite includes a walk-in wardrobe, and the rooftop terrace offers a hot tub and bar, providing breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside. This luxurious abode reflects Cheryl’s sophisticated taste and commitment to sustainable living.
Pete Doherty – Wiltshire, £1 Million
In 2007, Pete Doherty, the enigmatic frontman of The Libertines and Babyshambles, took residence in a charming six-bedroom country house in Marlborough, Wiltshire. This picturesque abode, nestled amidst the serene English countryside, offered a tranquil retreat from the bustling London scene.
The property featured spacious rooms adorned with period details, expansive gardens, and stables, providing ample space for Pete’s artistic endeavors and his beloved cats. The interior, however, bore the marks of his lifestyle, with remnants of parties and art projects adorning the walls. Despite this journey, the Wiltshire house became a testament to the rock star’s roller-coaster existence during that period.
